required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tazemetostat for the Treatment of Moderate to Severe COVID-19 Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Repurposing Tazemetostat for the Treatment of Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS) or Systemic Cytokine Release Syndrome (SCRS) in COVID-19 Patient

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of repurposing tazemetostat for the treatment of Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS) or Systemic Cytokine Release Syndrome (SCRS) in COVID-19 patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that tazemetostat will mitigate the hyperinflammatory effects of COVID-19 infection, prevent respiratory deterioration, and reduce requirements of invasive ventilation. This will be conducted as a Phase II open label study. After being informed about the study and potential risks, all patients giving written informed consent will undergo randomization to receive 800 mg tazemetostat BID for 15 days in addition to standard of care treatment. The duration of the interventional part of the study will last 15 days, additionally the patients will be evaluated at 30 and 90 days for overall clinical status and sequelae. The study will be conducted at a single site (Loma Linda University Medical Center).

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluating the ability of tazemetostat to reduce need for mechanical ventilation and ECMO in severe COVID-19 patients
primary_outcome.description: 15 days after treatment initiation investigators will assess the composite endpoint of requirement for mechanical ventilation or ECMO

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effect of tazemetostat treatment of the course of COVID-19 disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date discharge or in-hospital death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize this outcome measure, investigators will assess the length of stay in the hospital.

other_outcome.measure: Evaluating the change in inflammatory status in response to tazemetostat
other_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization up to 15 days
other_outcome.description: CRP levels, ESR, IL-6, D-dimer, lactate dehydrogenase, neutrophil-to-lymphocyte ratio, cardiac troponin, renal biomarkers, lymphocytes and platelet count

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive tazemetostat 800mg BID for 15 days in addition to standard of care treatment. The duration of the interventional part of the study will last 15 days.
Subjects receiving standard of care treatment

intervention.description: Tazemetostat 800mg BID PO dosing for 15 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of signed and dated informed consent form
- Stated willingness to comply with all study procedures and availability for the duration of the study.
- Male or female, aged 18-85
- Diagnosed with q-PCR confirmed infection with SARS-Cov-2 virus and admitted to the hospital.
- Receiving non-invasive respiratory support through a nasal cannula or a face mask.
- Ability to take oral medication and be willing to adhere to the tazemetostat regimen.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to take PO medication.
- Need for intubation or ECMO.
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Known allergic reactions to tazemetostat.
- Active malignancy (not in remission).
- Treatment with another investigational drug.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, Assistant Professor, Gynecology & Obstetrics and Basic Sciences

clinical_study.keyword: Systemic Cytokine Release Syndrome Due to SARS-CoV-2 Disease
